output:
  pdf_document: default
  html_document: default
---
mpg = read.csv(file.choose(), header = T)

```{r}
#adding loess curve to fit data lines
mpg %>% ggplot(aes(x=displ, y=hwy)) + geom_smooth()

#adding more curves to fit more data 
mpg %>% ggplot(aes(x=displ, y=hwy, linetype=drv)) + geom_smooth()

#scatter plot
mpg %>% ggplot(aes(x=hwy, y=cty, color=mpg$drv)) + geom_point()

#using smooth on the scatter plot data above
mpg %>% ggplot(aes(x=hwy, y=cty, color=mpg$drv)) + geom_smooth()

#smooth + scatter
mpg %>% ggplot(aes(x=hwy, y=cty, color=mpg$drv)) + geom_smooth() + geom_point()

#adding color to plots based on class
ggplot(data = mpg) +
geom_point(mapping = aes(x=hwy, y=cty, color=class)) +
geom_smooth(mapping = aes(x=hwy, y=cty, linetype=drv, color=drv))

#adding ilnes to individual points and changing colors
ggplot(data = mpg) +
geom_point(mapping = aes(x=hwy, y=cty, color=class)) +
geom_smooth(mapping = aes(x=hwy, y=cty, linetype=class, color=class))

#adding a facet wrap to separate graphs
ggplot(data = mpg) +
geom_point(mapping = aes(x=hwy, y=cty, color=class)) +
geom_smooth(mapping = aes(x=hwy, y=cty, linetype=class, color=class)) + 
facet_wrap(~class)

#making labels
mpg %>% ggplot(aes(x=displ, y=hwy, linetype=drv)) + geom_smooth() + ggtitle("This is a graph") + xlab("This is an x-axis label") + ylab("This is a y-axis label")

#in-depth facets
ggplot(data = mpg) +
geom_point(mapping = aes(x=hwy, y=cty, color=class)) +
geom_smooth(mapping = aes(x=hwy, y=cty, linetype=class, color=class)) + 
facet_grid(drv~class)

#facet with geom hist
ggplot(data= mpg, aes(fill=drv)) + geom_histogram(mapping=aes(x=cty)) + facet_grid(drv~class)

#statistical transformations, stat identity to get actual counts of vehicle
mpg %>% ggplot(aes(x=class, y=cty)) + geom_bar(stat="identity")

#position stacked bar chart
mpg %>% ggplot(aes(x=class, fill=drv)) + geom_bar(position="stack")

#position dodge bar chart
mpg %>% ggplot(aes(x=class, fill=drv)) + geom_bar(position="dodge")

#positions fill - bar chart
mpg %>% ggplot(aes(x=class, fill=drv)) + geom_bar(position="fill")

#position jitter
mpg %>% ggplot(aes(x=displ, y=hwy)) + geom_point(position="jitter")


```
